definition: without meaning/nonsense/immoral/faithless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless

sentences.english: There are two approaches to directly overcome disease caused by nonsense mutations.
sentences.chinese: 有两种方法被用于治疗无义突变引起的疾病。

sentences.english: As long as you love me, I will definitely not lack of justice.
sentences.chinese: 只要你们对我有情，我绝对不会无义。

sentences.english: The problem comes when life intervenes, and suddenly that simple answer proves to be empty.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在现实生活中，这些回答就显得空洞无义。

definition: not benevolent/heartless/numb
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
injustice
to be ungrateful
ungrateful
ungrateful/heartless/to fail to be loyal to one's love
lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom)/cruel and unscrupulous
feelings of gratitude and loyalty
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
don't blame (sb)
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
excessive tendency to clemency (idiom)/soft-hearted (pejorative)
